taxon_name.authority: (Standley) Ulbrich in H. G. A. Engler et al.

place_of_publication.publication_title: in H. G. A. Engler et al., Nat. Pflanzenfam. ed.
in N. L. Britton et al., N. Amer. Fl.

bio:treatment.description: Plants annual or short-lived perennial, erect to procumbent or diffuse. Leaves with Kranz-type anatomy. Pistillate flowers lacking perianth, enclosed by a pair of bracteoles. Bracteoles distinct or united, thin or variously thickened, but not spongy, appendages tuberculate, foliaceous, inflated, spinose, or lacking, not spongy. Seeds ascending or erect; radicle lateral.
introduced in United States and elsewhere

verbatim.text: Species ca. 36 species (2 in the flora): introduced in United States and elsewhere, Australia.

parsed.discussion: Species ca. 36 species (2 in the flora)
parsed.distribution: introduced in United States and elsewhere, Australia.
